Guia_0305
Ana Clara Lonczynski - 0860668

a.) 110101(2) – 1011(2)

110101(2) - 001011(2) = X(2)
C2(001011) = 110100 + 1 = 110101
110101(2) + 110101 = (1) 101010

b.) 101,1001(2) – 3,1(8)

   3 ,   1
[011],[001]

101,1001 - 011,0010 = X(2)
C2(011,0010) = 100,1101 + 1 = 100,1110
101,1001 + 100,1110 = 110,0111

c.) 213(4) – 3D(16)

  2   1   3   -     3     D
[10][01][11]  - [0011][1101]

00100111 - 00111101 = x(2)
C2(00111101) = 11000010 + 1 = 11000011
00100111 + 11000011 = 11101010

d.) C5(16) – 1011001(2)

    C     5  
[1100][0101]  

11000101 - 01011001 = X(2)
C2(01011001) = 10100110 + 1 = 10100111
11000101 + 10100111 = (1) 01101100

e.) 7E(10) – 2D(16)

    7     E   -      2     D 
[0111][1110]  -  [0010][1101]

01111110 - 00101101 = x(2)
C2(00101101) = 11010010 + 1 = 11010011

01111110 + 11010011 = (1) 01010001
